text: Bottle @cgarvieuk, The Keith Tasting, April 2nd. [Rating Backlog] Pours golden, slight white head. Nose is quite bland, but some hay and lemon, nothing bad. taste is banana, cloves, lemon and a buttery finish.
Bottle. Clear pale golden. Nose is grainy malty, spices, wheat, barnyard. Tastes pale malts, fruits.
From bottle. Nose of yeast, citrus, orange zest. Taste is light malts and full bodied, very long finish.

Bottle thanks to brewer.
Appearance - golden with a decent head. It disappears fast. 
Nose - lemon and malt.
Taste - more of the same. A bit like a Kolsch but some banana coming through.
Palate - close to medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry finish.
Overall - it is a decent beer but not necessarily as creamy as Id hoped for from the style.

Bottle at Craigs, thanks to Keiths only homer  BenH. It pours clear pissy gold with a medium white head. The nose is rather mellow, white bread, cracker, cereal and dull sweet banana. The taste is soft, mellow banana, straw, wheaten bread, hay, apple and soft fruits with a smooth finish. Medium body and average carbonation. Cant say filtered wheat beer is my favourite style, but there is nothing wrong with this juan. Okay.
Bottle. Clear golden with white head. Aroma of cereal, earth, lemon. Taste is earthy, lemon, banana. Dry and a bit thin. Had worse
Bottle at Craigs. Pours pale gold with a thin white head. Aromas of faint spice. Taste is thin, light clove finish.
Bottle at craigs. Pours clear golden, smells like a farmers field, taste is wheaty, light banana, yeasty.
bottle at home .. golden yellow ... thin white lacing ... soft sweet fruit nose ... hay .. soft fruit ... floral fruits .. sweet fruit .. light lemon

330ml bottle at home shared with Stuartyboy, from The Whisky Trail, 324 Lawnmarket, Edinburgh (bb 30 Sep 2016), yeasty aroma with some banana, golden with a rapidly disappearing bubbly white head, yeasty, grassy, flavour with some banana, very easy to drink.
Bottle shared with Mr_H a clear golden ale with banana and wheat aroma flavour is fruity with wheat grain notes slightly sweet finish
